verse.language: Love righteousness, ye that be judges of the earth: think of the Lord with a good (heart,) and in simplicity of heart seek him.
احبوا العدل يا قضاة الارض واعتقدوا في الرب خيرا والتمسوه بقلب سليم
Kasihilah kebenaran, hai para penguasa dunia, hendaklah pikiranmu tertuju kepada Tuhan dengan tulus ikhlas, dan carilah Dia dengan tulus hati!
For he will be found of them that tempt him not; and sheweth himself unto such as do not distrust him.
فانما يجده الذين لا يجربونه ويتجلى للذين لا يكفرون به
Ia membiarkan diri-Nya ditemukan oleh yang tidak mencobai-Nya, dan menampakkan diri kepada semua yang tidak menaruh syak wasangka terhadap-Nya.
For froward thoughts separate from God: and his power, when it is tried, reproveth the unwise.
لان الافكار الزائغة تقصي من الله واختبار قدرته يثقف الجهال
Pikiran bengkang-bengkung menjauhkan dari pada Allah, dan kekuasaan-Nya yang diuji mengenyahkan orang bodoh.
For into a malicious soul wisdom shall not enter; nor dwell in the body that is subject unto sin.
ان الحكمة لا تلج النفس الساعية بالمكر ولا تحل في الجسد المسترق للخطية
Sebab kebijaksanaan tidak masuk ke dalam hati keruh, dan tidak pula tinggal dalam tubuh yang dikuasai oleh dosa.
For the holy spirit of discipline will flee deceit, and remove from thoughts that are without understanding, and will not abide when unrighteousness cometh in.
لان روح التاديب القدوس يهرب من الغش ويتحول عن الافكار السفيهة وينهزم اذا حضر الاثم
Roh pendidik yang suci menghindarkan tipu daya, dan pikiran pandir dijauhinya.
For wisdom is a loving spirit; and will not acquit a blasphemer of his words: for God is witness of his reins, and a true beholder of his heart, and a hearer of his tongue.
ان روح الحكمة محب للانسان فلا يبرئ المجدف مما نطق لان الله ناظر لكليتيه ورقيب لقلبه لا يغفل وسامع لفمه

Sebab kebijaksanaan adalah roh yang sayang akan manusia, tetapi orang penghujat tidak dibiarkannya terluput dari hukuman karena ucapan bibirnya. Memang Allah menyaksikan hati sanubarinya, benar-benar mengawasi isi hatinya dan mendengarkan ucapan lidahnya.
For the Spirit of the Lord filleth the world: and that which containeth all things hath knowledge of the voice.
لان روح الرب ملا المسكونة وواسع الكل عنده علم كل كلمة
Sebab roh Tuhan memenuhi dunia semesta, dan Ia yang merangkum segala-galanya mengetahui apapun yang disuarakan.
Therefore he that speaketh unrighteous things cannot be hid: neither shall vengeance, when it punisheth, pass by him.
فلذلك لا يخفى عليه ناطق بسوء ولا ينجو من القضاء المفحم
Maka tidaklah tersembunyi siapa saja yang fasik bicaranya, dan tidak dilewatkan keadilan penghukum.
For inquisition shall be made into the counsels of the ungodly: and the sound of his words shall come unto the Lord for the manifestation of his wicked deeds.
لكن سيفحص عن افكار المنافق وكل ما سمع من اقواله يبلغ الى الرب فيحكم على اثامه
Rencana orang fasik akan diselidiki kelak, dan laporan tentang perkataannya sampai ke hadapan Tuhan, supaya pelanggaran-pelanggarannya dihukum.
For the ear of jealousy heareth all things: and the noise of murmurings is not hid.
لان الاذن الغيرى تسمع كل شيء وصياح المتذمرين لا يخفى عليها
Sebab telinga-Nya dengan cemburu mendengar segala sesuatu, malah bunyi gerutupun tak tersembunyi.
Therefore beware of murmuring, which is unprofitable; and refrain your tongue from backbiting: for there is no word so secret, that shall go for nought: and the mouth that belieth slayeth the soul.
فاحترزوا من التذمر الذي لا خير فيه وكفوا السنتكم عن الثلب فان المنطوق به في الخفية لا يذهب سدى والفم الكاذب يقتل النفس
Jadi, waspadalah terhadap gerutu yang sia-sia, dan awasilah lidahmu agar jangan memfitnah. Karena omongan tersembunyipun pasti ada akibatnya, dan mulut yang berdusta mematikan orang.
Seek not death in the error of your life: and pull not upon yourselves destruction with the works of your hands.
لا تغاروا على الموت في ضلال حياتكم ولا تجلبوا عليكم الهلاك باعمال ايديكم
Jangan mencari-cari maut dengan hidup sesat, dan kebinasaan jangan kamu tarik dengan perbuatan tanganmu.
For God made not death: neither hath he pleasure in the destruction of the living.
اذ ليس الموت من صنع الله ولا هلاك الاحياء يسره
Memang maut tidak dibuat oleh Allah, dan Iapun tak bergembira karena yang hidup musnah lenyap.
For he created all things, that they might have their being: and the generations of the world were healthful; and there is no poison of destruction in them, nor the kingdom of death upon the earth:
لانه انما خلق الجميع للبقاء فمواليد العالم انما كونت معافاة وليس فيها سم مهلك ولا ولاية للجحيم على الارض
Sebaliknya Ia menciptakan segala-galanya supaya ada, dan supaya makhluk-makhluk jagat menyelamatkan. Di antaranyapun tidak ada racun yang membinasakan, dan dunia orang mati tidak merajai bumi.
(For righteousness is immortal:)
لان البر خالد
Maka kesucian mesti baka.

But ungodly men with their works and words called it to them: for when they thought to have it their friend, they consumed to nought, and made a covenant with it, because they are worthy to take part with it.
لكن المنافقين هم استدعوا الموت بايديهم واقوالهم ظنوه حليفا لهم فاضمحلوا وانما عاهدوه لانهم اهل ان يكونوا من حزبه

Tetapi dengan perbuatan dan kata para fasik telah memanggil maut dan didambakannya sambil memandangnya sebagai sahabat. Mereka mengadakan perjanjian dengannya, oleh karena mereka patut menjadi bagiannya.

For the ungodly said, reasoning with themselves, but not aright, Our life is short and tedious, and in the death of a man there is no remedy: neither was there any man known to have returned from the grave.
فانهم بزيغ افكارهم قالوا في انفسهم ان حياتنا قصيرة شقية وليس لممات الانسان من دواء ولم يعلم قط ان احدا رجع من الجحيم

Karena angan-angannya tidak tepat maka berkatalah mereka satu sama lain: "Pendek dan menyedihkan hidup kita ini, dan pada akhir hidup manusia tidak ada obat mujarab; seseorang yang kembali dari dunia orang mati tidak dikenal.
For we are born at all adventure: and we shall be hereafter as though we had never been: for the breath in our nostrils is as smoke, and a little spark in the moving of our heart:
انا ولدنا اتفاقا وسنكون من بعد كانا لم نكن قط لان النسمة في انافنا دخان والنطق شرارة من حركة قلوبنا
Serba kebetulan kita dijadikan, dan kelak kita ini seolah-olah tak pernah ada. Asap sajalah nafas di dalam hidung kita, dan pikiran hanya merupakan bunga api dari denyut jantung kita.
Which being extinguished, our body shall be turned into ashes, and our spirit shall vanish as the soft air,
فاذا انطفات عاد الجسم رمادا وانحل الروح كنسيم رقيق وزالت حياتنا كاثر غمامة واضمحلت مثل ضباب يسوقه شعاع الشمس ويسقط بحرها
Setelah padam maka tubuh akan menjadi abu, dan rohnya akan disebar-sebarkan bagaikan udara yang halus.

And our name shall be forgotten in time, and no man shall have our works in remembrance, and our life shall pass away as the trace of a cloud, and shall be dispersed as a mist, that is driven away with the beams of the sun, and overcome with the heat thereof.
و بعد حين ينسى اسمنا ولا يذكر احد اعمالنا

Maka lambat laun nama kitapun terlupa pula, dan pekerjaan kita tidak seorangpun ingat kepadanya. Laksana jejak awan hidup kita berlalu, bagaikan kabut menghilang, dan dienyahkan oleh sinar matahari terkena oleh panas teriknya.
For our time is a very shadow that passeth away; and after our end there is no returning: for it is fast sealed, so that no man cometh again.
انما حياتنا ظل يمضي ولا مرجع لنا بعد الموت لانه يختم علينا فلا يعود احد
Umur hidup kita merupakan bayang-bayang yang berlalu, dan akhir hidup kita tak dapat ditunda, karena sudah dimeteraikan dan tak seorangpun dapat merubahnya.
Come on therefore, let us enjoy the good things that are present: and let us speedily use the creatures like as in youth.
فتعالوا نتمتع بالطيبات الحاضرة ونبتدر منافع الوجود ما دمنا في الشبيبة
Jadi, marilah kita menikmati hal-hal baik yang masih ada, dan bergegas menggunakan alam seperti di masa muda!
Let us fill ourselves with costly wine and ointments: and let no flower of the spring pass by us:
و نترو من الخمر الفاخرة ونتضمخ بالادهان ولا تفتنا زهرة الاوان
Marilah kita manfaatkan air anggur yang mahal serta wangi-wangian sepuas-puasnya, dan bunga musim semi janganlah kita lewatkan!
Let us crown ourselves with rosebuds, before they be withered:
و نتكلل بالورد قبل ذبوله ولا يكن مرج الا تمر لنا فيه لذة
Marilah kita mengenakan karangan kuncup mawar sebelum jadi layu!
Let none of us go without his part of our voluptuousness: let us leave tokens of our joyfulness in every place: for this is our portion, and our lot is this.
و لا يكن فينا من لا يشترك في لذاتنا ولنترك في كل مكان اثار الفرح فان هذا حظنا ونصيبنا
Di antara kita jangan seorangpun mengelakkan diri dari kesukaan kita! Hendaklah di mana-mana kita tinggalkan tanda-tanda keriangan kita, sebab itulah bagian dan nasib kita!"
Let us oppress the poor righteous man, let us not spare the widow, nor reverence the ancient gray hairs of the aged.
لنجر على الفقير الصديق ولا نشفق على الارملة ولا نهب شيبة الشيخ الكثير الايام
"Mari kita menindas orang miskin yang benar, jangan kita mengasihani janda, dan jangan peduli akan uban orang yang lanjut usia.
Let our strength be the law of justice: for that which is feeble is found to be nothing worth.
و لتكن قوتنا هي شريعة العدل فانه من الثابت ان الضعف لا يغني شيئا
Kekuatan kita hendaknya menjadi kaidah keadilan, sebab yang lemah ternyata tidak berguna.

Therefore let us lie in wait for the righteous; because he is not for our turn, and he is clean contrary to our doings: he upbraideth us with our offending the law, and objecteth to our infamy the transgressings of our education.
و لنكمن للصديق فانه ثقيل علينا يقاوم اعمالنا ويقرعنا على مخالفتنا للناموس ويفضح ذنوب سيرتنا

Marilah kita menghadang orang yang baik, sebab bagi kita ia menjadi gangguan serta menentang pekerjaan kita. Pelanggaran-pelanggaran hukum dituduhkannya kepada kita, dan kepada kita dipersalahkannya dosa-dosa terhadap pendidikan kita.
He professeth to have the knowledge of God: and he calleth himself the child of the Lord.
يزعم ان عنده علم الله ويسمي نفسه ابن الرب
Ia membanggakan mempunyai pengetahuan tentang Allah, dan menyebut dirinya anak Tuhan.
He was made to reprove our thoughts.
و قد صار لنا عذولا حتى على افكارنا
Bagi kita ia merupakan celaan atas anggapan kita, hanya melihat dia saja sudah berat rasanya bagi kita.
He is grievous unto us even to behold: for his life is not like other men's, his ways are of another fashion.
بل منظره ثقيل علينا لان سيرته تخالف سيرة الناس وسبله تباين سبلهم
Sebab hidupnya sungguh berlainan dari kehidupan orang lain, dan lain dari lainlah langkah lakunya.
We are esteemed of him as counterfeits: he abstaineth from our ways as from filthiness: he pronounceth the end of the just to be blessed, and maketh his boast that God is his father.
قد حسبنا كزيوف فهو يجانب طرقنا مجانبة الرجس ويغبط موت الصديقين ويتباهى بان الله ابوه

Kita dianggap olehnya sebagai orang yang tidak sejati, dan langkah laku kita dijauhinya seolah-olah najis adanya. Akhir hidup orang benar dipujinya bahagia, dan ia bermegah-megah bahwa bapanya ialah Allah.
Let us see if his words be true: and let us prove what shall happen in the end of him.
فلننظر هل اقواله حق ولنختبر كيف تكون عاقبته
Coba kita lihat apakah perkataannya benar dan ujilah apa yang terjadi waktu ia berpulang.
For if the just man be the son of God, he will help him, and deliver him from the hand of his enemies.
فانه ان كان الصديق ابن الله فهو ينصره وينقذه من ايدي مقاوميه
Jika orang yang benar itu sungguh anak Allah, niscaya Ia akan menolong dia serta melepaskannya dari tangan para lawannya.
Let us examine him with despitefulness and torture, that we may know his meekness, and prove his patience.
فلنمتحنه بالشتم والعذاب حتى نعلم حلمه ونختبر صبره
Mari, kita mencobainya dengan aniaya dan siksa, agar kita mengenal kelembutannya serta menguji kesabaran hatinya.
Let us condemn him with a shameful death: for by his own saying he shall be respected.
و لنقض عليه باقبح ميتة فانه سيفتقد كما يزعم
Hendaklah kita menjatuhkan hukuman mati keji terhadapnya, sebab menurut katanya ia pasti mendapat pertolongan."
Such things they did imagine, and were deceived: for their own wickedness hath blinded them.
هذا ما ارتاوه فضلوا لان شرهم اعماهم
Demikianlah mereka berangan-angan, tapi mereka sesat, karena telah dibutakan oleh kejahatan mereka.
As for the mysteries of God, they knew them not: neither hoped they for the wages of righteousness, nor discerned a reward for blameless souls.
فلم يدركوا اسرار الله ولم يرجوا جزاء القداسة ولم يعتبروا ثواب النفوس الطاهرة
Maka mereka tidak tahu akan rahasia-rahasia Allah, tidak yakin akan ganjaran kesucian, dan tidak menghargakan kemuliaan bagi jiwa yang murni.
For God created man to be immortal, and made him to be an image of his own eternity.
فان الله خلق الانسان خالدا وصنعه على صورة ذاته
Sebab Allah telah menciptakan manusia untuk kebakaan, dan dijadikan-Nya gambar hakekat-Nya sendiri.
Nevertheless through envy of the devil came death into the world: and they that do hold of his side do find it.
لكن بحسد ابليس دخل الموت الى العالم
Tetapi karena dengki setan maka maut masuk ke dunia, dan yang menjadi milik setan mencari maut itu.
But the souls of the righteous are in the hand of God, and there shall no torment touch them.
اما نفوس الصديقين فهي بيد الله فلا يمسها العذاب
Tetapi jiwa orang benar ada di tangan Allah, dan siksaan tiada menimpa mereka.
In the sight of the unwise they seemed to die: and their departure is taken for misery,
و في ظن الجهال انهم ماتوا وقد حسب خروجهم شقاء
Menurut pandangan orang bodoh mereka mati nampaknya, dan pulang mereka dianggap malapetaka,
And their going from us to be utter destruction: but they are in peace.
و ذهابهم عنا عطبا اما هم ففي السلام
dan kepergiannya dari kita dipandang sebagai kehancuran, namun mereka berada dalam ketenteraman.
For though they be punished in the sight of men, yet is their hope full of immortality.
و مع انهم قد عوقبوا في عيون الناس فرجاؤهم مملوء خلودا
Kalaupun mereka disiksa menurut pandangan manusia, namun harapan mereka penuh kebakaan.
And having been a little chastised, they shall be greatly rewarded: for God proved them, and found them worthy for himself.
و بعد تاديب يسير لهم ثواب عظيم لان الله امتحنهم فوجدهم اهلا له
Setelah disiksa sebentar mereka menerima anugerah yang besar, sebab Allah hanya menguji mereka, lalu mendapati mereka layak bagi diri-Nya.
As gold in the furnace hath he tried them, and received them as a burnt offering.
محصهم كالذهب في البودقة وقبلهم كذبيحة محرقة
Laksana emas dalam dapur api diperiksalah mereka oleh-Nya, lalu diterima bagaikan korban bakaran.
And in the time of their visitation they shall shine, and run to and fro like sparks among the stubble.
فهم في وقت افتقادهم يتلالاون ويسعون سعي الشرار بين القصب
Maka pada waktu pembalasan mereka akan bercahaya, dan laksana bunga api berlari-larian di ladang jerami.
They shall judge the nations, and have dominion over the people, and their Lord shall reign for ever.
و يدينون الامم ويتسلطون على الشعوب ويملك ربهم الى الابد
Mereka akan mengadili para bangsa dan memerintah sekalian rakyat, dan Tuhan berkenan memerintah mereka selama-lamanya.
They that put their trust in him shall understand the truth: and such as be faithful in love shall abide with him: for grace and mercy is to his saints, and he hath care for his elect.
المتوكلون عليه سيفهمون الحق والامناء في المحبة سيلازمونه لان النعمة والرحمة لمختاريه
Orang yang telah percaya pada Allah akan memahami kebenaran, dan yang setia dalam kasih akan tinggal pada-Nya. Sebab kasih setia dan belas kasihan menjadi bagian orang-orang pilihan-Nya.
But the ungodly shall be punished according to their own imaginations, which have neglected the righteous, and forsaken the Lord.
اما المنافقون فسينالهم العقاب الخليق بمشوراتهم اذ استهانوا بالصديق وارتدوا عن الرب
Tetapi para fasik mendapat hukuman sesuai dengan angan-angannya, oleh karena mereka tidak menghiraukan yang benar dan telah murtad dari pada Tuhan.
For whoso despiseth wisdom and nurture, he is miserable, and their hope is vain, their labours unfruitful, and their works unprofitable:
لان مزدري الحكمة والتاديب شقي انما رجاؤهم باطل واتعابهم بلا ثمرة واعمالهم لا فائدة فيها
Sungguh celakalah orang yang menghina kebijaksanaan dan ketertiban, hampalah harapan mereka dan sia-sialah jerih payahnya, dan segenap pekerjaannya percuma adanya.
Their wives are foolish, and their children wicked:
نساوهم سفيهات واولادهم اشرار
Para isteri mereka adalah bodoh, dan buruklah anak-anak mereka, keturunannya terkutuk.
Their offspring is cursed. Wherefore blessed is the barren that is undefiled, which hath not known the sinful bed: she shall have fruit in the visitation of souls.
و نسلهم ملعون اما العاقر الطاهرة التي لم تعرف المضجع الفاحش فطوبى لها انها ستحوز ثمرتها في افتقاد النفوس
Tetapi berbahagialah perempuan mandul yang tak bercela dan tidak melanggar hukum di ranjang perkawinan; ia akan memetik buahnya pada hari pembalasan sekalian jiwa.

And blessed is the eunuch, which with his hands hath wrought no iniquity, nor imagined wicked things against God: for unto him shall be given the special gift of faith, and an inheritance in the temple of the Lord more acceptable to his mind.
و طوبى للخصي الذي لم تباشر يده ماثما ولا افتكر قلبه بشر على الرب فانه سيعطى نعمة سامية لامانته وحظا شهيا في هيكل الرب

Demikianpun orang kebiri yang tangannya tidak berbuat jahat, dan yang tidak merencanakan yang buruk terhadap Tuhan. Untuk kesetiaannya ia akan diberi anugerah pilihan, dan bagian yang menyenangkan dalam Bait Tuhan.
For glorious is the fruit of good labours: and the root of wisdom shall never fall away.
لان ثمرة الاتعاب الصالحة فاخرة وجرثومة الفطنة راسخة
Sebab terpujilah buah hasil jerih payah yang baik, dan akar pengertianpun tak dapat binasa.
As for the children of adulterers, they shall not come to their perfection, and the seed of an unrighteous bed shall be rooted out.
اما اولاد الزناة فلا يبلغون اشدهم وذرية المضجع الاثيم تنقرض
Sebaliknya anak orang berzinah tidak menjadi dewasa, dan keturunan dari ranjang tak halal akan lenyap.
For though they live long, yet shall they be nothing regarded: and their last age shall be without honour.
ان طالت حياتهم فانهم يحسبون كلا شيء وفي اواخرهم تكون شيخوختهم بلا كرامة
Kalaupun mereka panjang umurnya, namun tidak dihargai sama sekali, dan hari tua mereka akhirnya tidak terhormat;
Or, if they die quickly, they have no hope, neither comfort in the day of trial.
و ان ماتوا سريعا فلا يكون لهم رجاء ولا عزاء في يوم الحساب
jika mereka lekas mati, maka tidak ada harapan bagi mereka, dan pada hari penghakiman mereka tidak mendapat hiburan.
For horrible is the end of the unrighteous generation.
لان عاقبة الجيل الاثيم هائلة
Sebab bangsa orang yang lalim beratlah ajalnya.
Better it is to have no children, and to have virtue: for the memorial thereof is immortal: because it is known with God, and with men.
ان البتولية مع الفضيلة اجمل فان معها ذكرا خالدا لانها تبقى معلومة عند الله والناس
Dari pada begitu lebih baik tidak beranak tapi memiliki keutamaan, sebab kenangan akan keutamaan adalah baka, karena dikenal baik oleh Allah maupun oleh manusia.
When it is present, men take example at it; and when it is gone, they desire it: it weareth a crown, and triumpheth for ever, having gotten the victory, striving for undefiled rewards.
اذا حضرت يقتدى بها واذا غابت يشتاق اليها ومدى الدهور تفتخر باكليل الظفر بعد انتصارها في ساحة المعارك الطاهرة
Jika ada keutamaan maka diteladan, jika sudah lenyap maka dirindukan orang. Selama-lamanya ia jaya sambil memakai karangan, karena telah menang dalam gelanggang pertandingan yang tak bercela.
But the multiplying brood of the ungodly shall not thrive, nor take deep rooting from bastard slips, nor lay any fast foundation.
اما لفيف المنافقين الكثير التوالد فلا ينجح وفراخهم النغلة لا تتعمق اصولها ولا تقوم على ساق راسخة
Jumlah besar anak para fasik tak menguntungkan, dan mereka tidak berakar dalam karena berasal dari carang tak asli, tidak pula mendapat alas yang kokoh kuat.

Of whose wickedness even to this day the waste land that smoketh is a testimony, and plants bearing fruit that never come to ripeness: and a standing pillar of salt is a monument of an unbelieving soul.

For regarding not wisdom, they gat not only this hurt, that they knew not the things which were good; but also left behind them to the world a memorial of their foolishness: so that in the things wherein they offended they could not so much as be hid.
و الذين اهملوا الحكمة لم ينحصر ظلمهم لانفسهم بجهلهم الصلاح ولكنهم خلفوا للناس ذكر حماقتهم بحيث لم يستطيعوا كتمانما زلوا فيه

For regarding not wisdom, they gat not only this hurt, that they knew not the things which were good; but also left behind them to the world a memorial of their foolishness: so that in the things wherein they offended they could not so much as be hid.
But wisdom delivered from pain those that attended upon her.
و اما الذين خدموا الحكمة فانقذتهم من كل نصب
But wisdom delivered from pain those that attended upon her.

When the righteous fled from his brother's wrath she guided him in right paths, shewed him the kingdom of God, and gave him knowledge of holy things, made him rich in his travels, and multiplied the fruit of his labours.
و هي التي قادت الصديق الهارب من غضب اخيه في سبل مستقيمة وارته ملكوت الله واتته علم القديسين وانجحته في اتعابه واكثرت ثمرات اعماله

When the righteous fled from his brother's wrath she guided him in right paths, shewed him the kingdom of God, and gave him knowledge of holy things, made him rich in his travels, and multiplied the fruit of his labours.
In the covetousness of such as oppressed him she stood by him, and made him rich.
و عند طماعة المستطيلين عليه انتصبت لمعونته واغنته
In the covetousness of such as oppressed him she stood by him, and made him rich.
She defended him from his enemies, and kept him safe from those that lay in wait, and in a sore conflict she gave him the victory; that he might know that goodness is stronger than all.
و وقته من اعدائه وحمته من الكامنين له واظفرته في القتال الشديد لكي يعلم ان التقوى اقدر من كل شيء
She defended him from his enemies, and kept him safe from those that lay in wait, and in a sore conflict she gave him the victory; that he might know that goodness is stronger than all.
When the righteous was sold, she forsook him not, but delivered him from sin: she went down with him into the pit,
و هي التي لم تخذل الصديق المبيع بل صانته من الخطيئة ونزلت معه في الجب
When the righteous was sold, she forsook him not, but delivered him from sin: she went down with him into the pit,

And left him not in bonds, till she brought him the sceptre of the kingdom, and power against those that oppressed him: as for them that had accused him, she shewed them to be liars, and gave him perpetual glory.
و في القيود لم تفارقه حتى ناولته صوالجة الملك وسلطانا على الذين قسروه وكذبت الذين عابوه واتته مجدا ابديا

And left him not in bonds, till she brought him the sceptre of the kingdom, and power against those that oppressed him: as for them that had accused him, she shewed them to be liars, and gave him perpetual glory.
She delivered the righteous people and blameless seed from the nation that oppressed them.
و هي التي انقذت شعبا مقدسا وزرية لا وصمة فيها من امة مضايقيهم
She delivered the righteous people and blameless seed from the nation that oppressed them.
She entered into the soul of the servant of the Lord, and withstood dreadful kings in wonders and signs;
و حلت نفس عبد للرب وقاومت ملوكا مرهوبين بعجائب وايات
She entered into the soul of the servant of the Lord, and withstood dreadful kings in wonders and signs;
Rendered to the righteous a reward of their labours, guided them in a marvellous way, and was unto them for a cover by day, and a light of stars in the night season;
و جزت القديسين ثواب اتعابهم وقادتهم في طريق عجيب وكانت لهم ظلا في النهار وضياء نجوم في الليل
Rendered to the righteous a reward of their labours, guided them in a marvellous way, and was unto them for a cover by day, and a light of stars in the night season;
Brought them through the Red sea, and led them through much water:
و عبرت بهم البحر الاحمر واجازتهم المياه الغزيرة
Brought them through the Red sea, and led them through much water:
But she drowned their enemies, and cast them up out of the bottom of the deep.
اما اعداؤهم فاغرقتهم ثم قذفتهم من عمق الغمار على الشاطئ فسلب الصديقون المنافقين
But she drowned their enemies, and cast them up out of the bottom of the deep.
Therefore the righteous spoiled the ungodly, and praised thy holy name, O Lord, and magnified with one accord thine hand, that fought for them.
و رنموا لاسمك القدوس ايها الرب وحمدوا بقلب واحد يدك الناصرة
Therefore the righteous spoiled the ungodly, and praised thy holy name, O Lord, and magnified with one accord thine hand, that fought for them.
For wisdom opened the mouth of the dumb, and made the tongues of them that cannot speak eloquent.
لان الحكمة فتحت افواه البكم وجعلت السنة الاطفال تفصح
For wisdom opened the mouth of the dumb, and made the tongues of them that cannot speak eloquent.
She prospered their works in the hand of the holy prophet.
ثم سددت مساعيهم بارشاد نبي قديس
She prospered their works in the hand of the holy prophet.
They went through the wilderness that was not inhabited, and pitched tents in places where there lay no way.
فساروا في برية لا ساكن بها وضربوا اخبيتهم في ارض قفرة
They went through the wilderness that was not inhabited, and pitched tents in places where there lay no way.
They stood against their enemies, and were avenged of their adversaries.
و قاوموا محاربيهم ودافعوا اعداءهم
They stood against their enemies, and were avenged of their adversaries.
When they were thirsty, they called upon thee, and water was given them out of the flinty rock, and their thirst was quenched out of the hard stone.
و في عطشهم دعوا اليك فاعطوا ماء من صخرة الصوان وشفاء لغليلهم من الحجر الجلمود
When they were thirsty, they called upon thee, and water was given them out of the flinty rock, and their thirst was quenched out of the hard stone.
For by what things their enemies were punished, by the same they in their need were benefited.
فكان الذي عذب به اعداؤهم اذ اعوزهم ما يشربون وبنو اسرائيل متهللون بكثرته
For by what things their enemies were punished, by the same they in their need were benefited.
For instead of a fountain of a perpetual running river troubled with foul blood,
هو الذي احسن به اليهم في عوزهم
For instead of a fountain of a perpetual running river troubled with foul blood,
For a manifest reproof of that commandment, whereby the infants were slain, thou gavest unto them abundance of water by a means which they hoped not for:
فانك بلبلت اولئك اذ بدلتهم بمعين النهر الدائم دما صديدا
For a manifest reproof of that commandment, whereby the infants were slain, thou gavest unto them abundance of water by a means which they hoped not for:
Declaring by that thirst then how thou hadst punished their adversaries.
عقابا لهم على قضائهم بقتل الاطفال وهؤلاء اعطيتهم ماء غزيرا عند الياس منه
Declaring by that thirst then how thou hadst punished their adversaries.
For when they were tried albeit but in mercy chastised, they knew how the ungodly were judged in wrath and tormented, thirsting in another manner than the just.
لكي تريهم بعطشهم هذا كيف عاقبت اضدادهم
For when they were tried albeit but in mercy chastised, they knew how the ungodly were judged in wrath and tormented, thirsting in another manner than the just.
For these thou didst admonish and try, as a father: but the other, as a severe king, thou didst condemn and punish.
فانهم بامتحانك لهم وان كان تاديب رحمة فهموا كيف كان عذاب المنافقين المقضي عليهم بالغضب
For these thou didst admonish and try, as a father: but the other, as a severe king, thou didst condemn and punish.
Whether they were absent or present, they were vexed alike.
لانك جربت هؤلاء كاب انذارا لهم واولئك ابتليتهم كملك قاس قضاء عليهم
Whether they were absent or present, they were vexed alike.
For a double grief came upon them, and a groaning for the remembrance of things past.
و قد مسهم في الغيب من الضر ما مسهم في المشهد
For a double grief came upon them, and a groaning for the remembrance of things past.
For when they heard by their own punishments the other to be benefited, they had some feeling of the Lord.
اذ اخذهم ضعفان من الحزن والنحيب بتذكر الضربات السالفة
For when they heard by their own punishments the other to be benefited, they had some feeling of the Lord.
For whom they rejected with scorn, when he was long before thrown out at the casting forth of the infants, him in the end, when they saw what came to pass, they admired.
لانهم لما سمعوا ان ما كان لهم عقابا صار لاعدائهم احسانا شعروا بيد الرب
For whom they rejected with scorn, when he was long before thrown out at the casting forth of the infants, him in the end, when they saw what came to pass, they admired.

But for the foolish devices of their wickedness, wherewith being deceived they worshipped serpents void of reason, and vile beasts, thou didst send a multitude of unreasonable beasts upon them for vengeance;
و الذي قضوا من قبل بطرحه في النهر واستخفوا به ورذلوه استعظموه في اخر الامر اذا كان عطش الصديقين على خلاف عطشهم

But for the foolish devices of their wickedness, wherewith being deceived they worshipped serpents void of reason, and vile beasts, thou didst send a multitude of unreasonable beasts upon them for vengeance;
That they might know, that wherewithal a man sinneth, by the same also shall he be punished.
و اذ كانوا قد سفهوا في افكارهم الاثيمة وضلوا حتى عبدوا زحافات حقيرة ووحوشا لا نطق لها انتقمت منهم بان ارسلت عليهم جما من الحيوانات التي لا نطق لها
That they might know, that wherewithal a man sinneth, by the same also shall he be punished.
For thy Almighty hand, that made the world of matter without form, wanted not means to send among them a multitude of bears or fierce lions,
لكي يعلموا ان ما خطئ به احد به يعاقب
For thy Almighty hand, that made the world of matter without form, wanted not means to send among them a multitude of bears or fierce lions,
Or unknown wild beasts, full of rage, newly created, breathing out either a fiery vapour, or filthy scents of scattered smoke, or shooting horrible sparkles out of their eyes:
و لم يكن صعبا على يدك القادرة على كل شيء التي صنعت العالم من مادة غير مصورة ان تبعث عليهم جما من الادباب او الاسود الباسلة
Or unknown wild beasts, full of rage, newly created, breathing out either a fiery vapour, or filthy scents of scattered smoke, or shooting horrible sparkles out of their eyes:
Whereof not only the harm might dispatch them at once, but also the terrible sight utterly destroy them.
او من اصناف جديدة لم تعرف من الوحوش الضارية التي تنفخ نارا او تبعث دخانا قاتما او ترسل من عيونها شرارا مخيفا
Whereof not only the harm might dispatch them at once, but also the terrible sight utterly destroy them.

Yea, and without these might they have fallen down with one blast, being persecuted of vengeance, and scattered abroad through the breath of thy power: but thou hast ordered all things in measure and number and weight.
اذا لكانت تهلكهم خوفا من منظرها فضلا عن ان تهشمهم باصابتها

Yea, and without these might they have fallen down with one blast, being persecuted of vengeance, and scattered abroad through the breath of thy power: but thou hast ordered all things in measure and number and weight.
For thou canst shew thy great strength at all times when thou wilt; and who may withstand the power of thine arm?
بل قد كان نفس كافيا لاسقاطهم فيتعقبهم القضاء وروح قدرتك يذريهم لكنك رتبت كل شيء بمقدار وعدد ووزن
For thou canst shew thy great strength at all times when thou wilt; and who may withstand the power of thine arm?
For the whole world before thee is as a little grain of the balance, yea, as a drop of the morning dew that falleth down upon the earth.
و عندك قدرة عظيمة في كل حين فمن يقاوم قوة ذراعك
For the whole world before thee is as a little grain of the balance, yea, as a drop of the morning dew that falleth down upon the earth.
But thou hast mercy upon all; for thou canst do all things, and winkest at the sins of men, because they should amend.
ان العالم كله امامك مثل ما ترجح به كفة الميزان وكنقطة ندى تسقط على الارض عند السحر
But thou hast mercy upon all; for thou canst do all things, and winkest at the sins of men, because they should amend.
For thou lovest all the things that are, and abhorrest nothing which thou hast made: for never wouldest thou have made any thing, if thou hadst hated it.
لكنك ترحم الجميع لانك قادر على كل شيء وتتغاضى عن خطايا الناس لكي يتوبوا
For thou lovest all the things that are, and abhorrest nothing which thou hast made: for never wouldest thou have made any thing, if thou hadst hated it.
And how could any thing have endured, if it had not been thy will? or been preserved, if not called by thee?
لانك تحب جميع الاكوان ولا تمقت شيئا مما صنعت فانك لو ابغضت شيئا لم تكونه
And how could any thing have endured, if it had not been thy will? or been preserved, if not called by thee?
But thou sparest all: for they are thine, O Lord, thou lover of souls.
و كيف يبقى شيء لم ترده ام كيف يحفظ ما لست انت داعيا له
But thou sparest all: for they are thine, O Lord, thou lover of souls.
For thine incorruptible Spirit is in all things.
ان في كل شيء روحك الذي لا فساد فيه
For thine incorruptible Spirit is in all things.

Therefore chastenest thou them by little and little that offend, and warnest them by putting them in remembrance wherein they have offended, that leaving their wickedness they may believe on thee, O Lord.
فبه توبخ الخطاة شيئا فشيئا وفيما يخطاون به تذكرهم وتنذرهم لكي يقلعوا عن الشر ويؤمنوا بك ايها الرب

Therefore chastenest thou them by little and little that offend, and warnest them by putting them in remembrance wherein they have offended, that leaving their wickedness they may believe on thee, O Lord.
For it was thy will to destroy by the hands of our fathers both those old inhabitants of thy holy land,
فانك ابغضت الذين كانوا قديما سكان ارضك المقدسة
For it was thy will to destroy by the hands of our fathers both those old inhabitants of thy holy land,
Whom thou hatedst for doing most odious works of witchcrafts, and wicked sacrifices;
لاجل اعمالهم الممقوتة لديك من السحر وذبائح الفجور
Whom thou hatedst for doing most odious works of witchcrafts, and wicked sacrifices;
And also those merciless murderers of children, and devourers of man's flesh, and the feasts of blood,
اذ كانوا يقتلون اولادهم بغير رحمة وياكلون احشاء الناس ويشربون دماءهم في شعائر عبادتك
And also those merciless murderers of children, and devourers of man's flesh, and the feasts of blood,
With their priests out of the midst of their idolatrous crew, and the parents, that killed with their own hands souls destitute of help:
فاثرت ان تهلك بايدي ابائنا اولئك الوالدين قتلة النفوس التي لا نصرة لها
With their priests out of the midst of their idolatrous crew, and the parents, that killed with their own hands souls destitute of help:
That the land, which thou esteemedst above all other, might receive a worthy colony of God's children.
لكي تكون الارض التي هي اكرم عندك من كل ارض عامرة بابناء الله كما يليق بها
That the land, which thou esteemedst above all other, might receive a worthy colony of God's children.
Nevertheless even those thou sparedst as men, and didst send wasps, forerunners of thine host, to destroy them by little and little.
على انك اشفقت على اولئك ايضا لانهم بشر فبعثت بالزنابير تتقدم عسكرك وتبيدهم شيئا بعد شيء
Nevertheless even those thou sparedst as men, and didst send wasps, forerunners of thine host, to destroy them by little and little.
Not that thou wast unable to bring the ungodly under the hand of the righteous in battle, or to destroy them at once with cruel beasts, or with one rough word:
لا لانك عجزت عن اخضاع المنافقين للصديقين بالقتال او تدميرهم بمرة بالوحوش الضارية او بامر جازم من عندك
Not that thou wast unable to bring the ungodly under the hand of the righteous in battle, or to destroy them at once with cruel beasts, or with one rough word:

But executing thy judgments upon them by little and little, thou gavest them place of repentance, not being ignorant that they were a naughty generation, and that their malice was bred in them, and that their cogitation would never be changed.
لكن بعقابهم شيئا فشيئا منحتهم مهلة للتوبة وان لم يخف عليك ان جيلهم شرير وان خبثهم غريزي وافكارهم لا تتغير الى الابد

But executing thy judgments upon them by little and little, thou gavest them place of repentance, not being ignorant that they were a naughty generation, and that their malice was bred in them, and that their cogitation would never be changed.
For it was a cursed seed from the beginning; neither didst thou for fear of any man give them pardon for those things wherein they sinned.
لانهم كانوا ذرية ملعونة منذ البدء ولم يكن عفوك عن خطاياهم خوفا من احد
For it was a cursed seed from the beginning; neither didst thou for fear of any man give them pardon for those things wherein they sinned.

For who shall say, What hast thou done? or who shall withstand thy judgment? or who shall accuse thee for the nations that perish, whom thou made? or who shall come to stand against thee, to be revenged for the unrighteous men?
فانه من يقول ماذا صنعت او يعترض قضاءك ومن يشكوك بهلاك الامم التي خلقتها او يقف بين يديك مخاصما عن اناس مجرمين

For who shall say, What hast thou done? or who shall withstand thy judgment? or who shall accuse thee for the nations that perish, whom thou made? or who shall come to stand against thee, to be revenged for the unrighteous men?
For neither is there any God but thou that careth for all, to whom thou mightest shew that thy judgment is not unright.
اذ ليس اله الا انت المعتني بالجميع حتى تري انك لا تقضي قضاء الظلم
For neither is there any God but thou that careth for all, to whom thou mightest shew that thy judgment is not unright.
Neither shall king or tyrant be able to set his face against thee for any whom thou hast punished.
و ليس لملك او سلطان ان يطالبك بالذين اهلكتهم
Neither shall king or tyrant be able to set his face against thee for any whom thou hast punished.
Forsomuch then as thou art righteous thyself, thou orderest all things righteously: thinking it not agreeable with thy power to condemn him that hath not deserved to be punished.
و اذ انت عادل تدبر الجميع بالعدل وتحسب القضاء على من لا يستوجب العقاب منافيا لقدرتك
Forsomuch then as thou art righteous thyself, thou orderest all things righteously: thinking it not agreeable with thy power to condemn him that hath not deserved to be punished.
For thy power is the beginning of righteousness, and because thou art the Lord of all, it maketh thee to be gracious unto all.
لان قوتك هي مبدا عدلك وبما انك رب الجميع فانت تشفق على الجميع
For thy power is the beginning of righteousness, and because thou art the Lord of all, it maketh thee to be gracious unto all.
For when men will not believe that thou art of a full power, thou shewest thy strength, and among them that know it thou makest their boldness manifest.
و انما تبدي قوتك للذين لا يؤمنون انك على كمال القدرة وتعاقب العلماء على جسارتهم
For when men will not believe that thou art of a full power, thou shewest thy strength, and among them that know it thou makest their boldness manifest.
But thou, mastering thy power, judgest with equity, and orderest us with great favour: for thou mayest use power when thou wilt.
لكنك ايها السلطان القدير تحكم بالرفق وتدبرنا باشفاق كثير لان في يدك ان تعمل بقدرة متى شئت
But thou, mastering thy power, judgest with equity, and orderest us with great favour: for thou mayest use power when thou wilt.
But by such works hast thou taught thy people that the just man should be merciful, and hast made thy children to be of a good hope that thou givest repentance for sins.
فعلمت شعبك باعمالك هذه ان الصديق ينبغي ان يكون محبا للناس وجعلت لبنيك رجاء حسنا لانك تمنحهم في خطاياهم مهلة للتوبة
But by such works hast thou taught thy people that the just man should be merciful, and hast made thy children to be of a good hope that thou givest repentance for sins.
For if thou didst punish the enemies of thy children, and the condemned to death, with such deliberation, giving them time and place, whereby they might be delivered from their malice:
لانك ان كنت عاقبت اعداء بنيك المستوجبين للموت بمثل هذا التحرز والترفق وجعلت لهم زمانا ومكانا للاقلاع عن الشر
For if thou didst punish the enemies of thy children, and the condemned to death, with such deliberation, giving them time and place, whereby they might be delivered from their malice:
With how great circumspection didst thou judge thine own sons, unto whose fathers thou hast sworn, and made covenants of good promises?
فباي اعتناء دبرت بنيك الذين واثقت اباءهم بالاقسام والعهود على مواعيدك الصالحة
With how great circumspection didst thou judge thine own sons, unto whose fathers thou hast sworn, and made covenants of good promises?

Therefore, whereas thou dost chasten us, thou scourgest our enemies a thousand times more, to the intent that, when we judge, we should carefully think of thy goodness, and when we ourselves are judged, we should look for mercy.
فتؤدبنا نحن وتجلد اعداءنا جلدا كثيرا لكي نتذكر حلمك اذا حكمنا وننتظر رحمتك اذا حكم علينا

Therefore, whereas thou dost chasten us, thou scourgest our enemies a thousand times more, to the intent that, when we judge, we should carefully think of thy goodness, and when we ourselves are judged, we should look for mercy.
Wherefore, whereas men have lived dissolutely and unrighteously, thou hast tormented them with their own abominations.
لاجل ذلك فالمنافقون الذين عاشوا بالسفه عذبتهم بارجاسهم عينها
Wherefore, whereas men have lived dissolutely and unrighteously, thou hast tormented them with their own abominations.
For they went astray very far in the ways of error, and held them for gods, which even among the beasts of their enemies were despised, being deceived, as children of no understanding.
فانهم في ضلالهم تجاوزوا طرق الضلال اذ اتخذوا ما يستحقره اعداؤهم من الحيوان الهة مغترين كاطفال لا يفقهون
For they went astray very far in the ways of error, and held them for gods, which even among the beasts of their enemies were despised, being deceived, as children of no understanding.
Therefore unto them, as to children without the use of reason, thou didst send a judgment to mock them.
لذلك بعثت عليهم عقاب اولاد لا عقل لهم للسخرية
Therefore unto them, as to children without the use of reason, thou didst send a judgment to mock them.
But they that would not be reformed by that correction, wherein he dallied with them, shall feel a judgment worthy of God.
و لما لم يتعظوا بتاديب السخرية ذاقوا العقاب اللائق بالله
But they that would not be reformed by that correction, wherein he dallied with them, shall feel a judgment worthy of God.

For, look, for what things they grudged, when they were punished, that is, for them whom they thought to be gods; [now] being punished in them, when they saw it, they acknowledged him to be the true God, whom before they denied to know: and therefore came extreme damnation upon them.
و فيما تحملوه بغيظهم وقد راوا ان ما اتخذوه الها كانوا به يعذبون عرفوا الاله الحق الذي كانوا يكفرون به ولذلك حلت بهم خاتمة العقاب

For, look, for what things they grudged, when they were punished, that is, for them whom they thought to be gods; [now] being punished in them, when they saw it, they acknowledged him to be the true God, whom before they denied to know: and therefore came extreme damnation upon them.
